00001 # Name:    interpreter.tcl
00002 # Author:  Trevor Williams  (phase1geo@gmail.com)
00003 # Date:    8/1/2014
00004 # Brief:   Namespace to support a plugin interpreter.
00005 
00006 namespace eval interpreter {
00007 
00008   array set interps {}
00009   
00010   ######################################################################
00011   # Check the given file's accessibility (the file should be translated
00012   # prior to calling this procedure).
00013   proc check_file_access {pname fname} {
00014   
00015     variable interps
00016     
00017     if {[$interps($pname,interp) issafe]} {
00018     
00019       # Normalize the file name
00020       set fname [file normalize $fname]
00021   
00022       # Verify that the directory is within the access paths
00023       foreach access_dir [lindex [::safe::interpConfigure $interps($pname,interp) -accessPath] 1] {
00024         if {[string compare -length [string length $access_dir] $access_dir $fname] == 0} {
00025           return $fname
00026         }
00027       }
00028   
00029       return ""
00030       
00031     } else {
00032     
00033       return $fname
00034       
00035     }
00036 
00037   }
00038   
00039   ######################################################################
00040   # Checks to make sure that the given directory is within the allowed
00041   # directory paths.  Returns the name of the file if the directory is
00042   # okay to process; otherwise, returns the empty string.
00043   proc check_file {pname fname} {
00044     
00045     variable interps
00046     
00047     # We only need to check the file if we are in safe mode.
00048     if {[$interps($pname,interp) issafe]} {
00049     
00050       # Translate the directory
00051       if {[catch {::safe::TranslatePath $interps($pname,interp) $fname} fname]} {
00052         return ""
00053       }
00054       
00055       return [check_file_access $pname $fname]
00056       
00057     } else {
00058       
00059       return $fname
00060       
00061     }
00062     
00063   }
00064   
00065   ######################################################################
00066   # Encodes the given filename, replacing the lower portion of the filename
00067   # with the appropriate encoded symbol which matches a value in the safe
00068   # interpreter directory list.
00069   proc encode_file {pname fname} {
00070   
00071     variable interps
00072     
00073     foreach access_dir [lindex [::safe::interpConfigure $interps($pname,interp) -accessPath] 1] {
00074       set access_len [string length $access_dir]
00075       if {[string compare -length $access_len $access_dir $fname] == 0} {
00076         return [file join [::safe::interpFindInAccessPath $interps($pname,interp) $access_dir] [string range $fname [expr $access_len + 1] end]]
00077       }
00078     }
00079     
00080     return ""
00081   
00082   }
00083   
00084   ######################################################################
00085   # Adds a ctext widget to the list of wins (however, destroying the
00086   # interpreter will not destroy the ctext widgets).
00087   proc add_ctext {pname txt} {
00088     
00089     variable interps
00090     
00091     lappend interps($pname,wins) [list $txt 0] [list $txt.t 0]
00092     
00093   }
00094   
00095   ######################################################################
00096   # Creates a widget on behalf of the plugin, records and returns its value.
00097   proc widget_command {pname widget win args} {
00098 
00099     variable interps
00100     
00101     set command_args [list \
00102       -command -postcommand -validatecommand -invalidcommand -xscrollcommand \
00103       -yscrollcommand \
00104     ]
00105     
00106     # Substitute any commands with the appropriate interpreter eval statement
00107     set opts [list]
00108     foreach {opt value} $args {
00109       if {[lsearch $command_args $opt] != -1} {
00110         set value [list $interps($pname,interp) eval {*}$value]
00111       }
00112       lappend opts $opt $value
00113     }
00114 
00115     # Create the widget
00116     $widget $win {*}$opts
00117 
00118     # Allow the interpreter to do things with the element
00119     $interps($pname,interp) alias $win interpreter::widget_win $pname $win
00120 
00121     # Record the widget
00122     lappend interps($pname,wins) [list $win 1]
00123 
00124     return $win
00125 
00126   }
00127   
00128   ######################################################################
00129   # Handles any widget calls to cget/configure commands.
00130   proc widget_win {pname win cmd args} {
00131     
00132     variable interps
00133     
00134     set command_args [list \
00135       -command -postcommand -validatecommand -invalidcommand -xscrollcommand \
00136       -yscrollcommand \
00137     ]
00138     
00139     switch $cmd {
00140       
00141       cget {
00142         set opt [lindex $args 0]
00143         if {[lsearch $command_args $opt] != -1} {
00144           return [lrange [$win cget $opt] 2 end]
00145         } else {
00146           return [$win cget $opt]
00147         }
00148       }
00149       
00150       entrycget {
00151         lassign $args entry_index opt
00152         if {[lsearch $command_args $opt] != -1} {
00153           return [lrange [$win entrycget $entry_index $opt] 2 end]
00154         } else {
00155           return [$win entrycget $entry_index $opt]
00156         }
00157       }
00158       
00159       configure {
00160         set retval [list]
00161         switch [llength $args] {
00162           0 {
00163             foreach opt [$win configure] {
00164               if {[lsearch $command_args [lindex $opt 0]] != -1} {
00165                 lset opt 4 [lrange [lindex $opt 4] 2 end]
00166               }
00167               lappend retval $opt
00168             }
00169             return $retval
00170           }
00171           1 {
00172             set opt    [lindex $args 0]
00173             set retval [$win configure $opt]
00174             if {[lsearch $command_args $opt] != -1} {
00175               lset retval 4 [lrange [lindex $retval 4] 2 end]
00176             }
00177             return $retval
00178           }
00179           default {
00180             foreach {opt value} $args {
00181               if {[lsearch $command_args $opt] != -1} {
00182                 set value "$interps($pname,interp) eval $value"
00183               }
00184               lappend retval $opt $value
00185             }
00186             return [$win configure {*}$retval]
00187           }
00188         }
00189       }
00190       
00191       entryconfigure {
00192         set retval [list]
00193         set args [lassign $args entry_index]
00194         switch [llength $args] {
00195           0 {
00196             foreach opt [$win entryconfigure $entry_index] {
00197               if {[lsearch $command_args [lindex $opt 0]] != -1} {
00198                 lset opt 4 [lrange [lindex $opt 4] 2 end]
00199               }
00200               lappend retval $opt
00201             }
00202             return $retval
00203           }
00204           1 {
00205             set opt    [lindex $args 0]
00206             set retval [$win entryconfigure $entry_index $opt]
00207             if {[lsearch $command_args $opt] != -1} {
00208               lset retval 4 [lrange [lindex $retval 4 2 end]
00209             }
00210             return $retval
00211           }
00212           default {
00213             foreach {opt value} $args {
00214               if {[lsearch $command_args $opt] != -1} {
00215                 set value [list $interps($pname,interp) eval {*}$value]
00216               }
00217               lappend retval $opt $value
00218             }
00219             return [$win entryconfigure $entry_index {*}$retval]
00220           }
00221         }
00222       }
00223       
00224       add {
00225         # Handle adding commands to menus
00226         set args [lassign $args retval]
00227         foreach {opt value} $args {
00228           if {[lsearch $command_args $opt] != -1} {
00229             set value [list $interps($pname,interp) eval {*}$value]
00230           }
00231           lappend retval $opt $value
00232         }
00233         return [$win add {*}$retval]
00234       }
00235       
00236       tag {
00237         # Handle adding bindings to text/ctext widgets
00238         set args [lassign $args subcmd]
00239         if {$subcmd eq "bind"} {
00240           switch [llength $args] {
00241             3 {
00242               return [string map [list "$interps($pname,interp) eval " ""] [$win tag bind {*}$args]]
00243             }
00244             4 {
00245               if {[string index [lindex $args end] 0] == "+"} {
00246                 return [$win tag bind {*}[lrange $args 0 end-1] [list +$interps($pname,interp) eval {*}[lindex $args end]]]
00247               } else {
00248                 return [$win tag bind {*}[lrange $args 0 end-1] [list $interps($pname,interp) eval {*}[lindex $args end]]]
00249               }
00250             }
00251             default {
00252               return [$win tag bind {*}$args]
00253             }
00254           }
00255         }
00256       }
00257       
00258       default {
00259         return [$win $cmd {*}$args]
00260       }
00261     }
00262     
00263   }
00264   
00265   ######################################################################
00266   # Destroys the specified widget (if it was created by the interpreter
00267   # specified by pname).
00268   proc destroy_command {pname win} {
00269 
00270     variable interps
00271 
00272     if {[set win_index [lsearch $interps($pname,wins) [list $win 1]]] != -1} {
00273       set interps($pname,wins) [lreplace $intersp($pname,wins) $win_index $win_index]
00274       catch { destroy $win }
00275     }
00276 
00277   }
00278   
00279   ######################################################################
00280   # Binds an event to a widget owned by the slave interpreter.
00281   proc bind_command {pname tag args} {
00282   
00283     variable interps
00284     
00285     switch [llength $args] {
00286       1 { return [bind $tag [lindex $args 0]] }
00287       2 { 
00288         if {[string index [lindex $args 1] 0] eq "+"} {
00289           return [bind $tag [lindex $args 0] [list +interp eval $interps($pname,interp) [lrange [lindex $args 1] 1 end]]]
00290         } else {
00291           return [bind $tag [lindex $args 0] [list interp eval $interps($pname,interp) [lindex $args 1]]]
00292         }
00293       }
00294     }
00295     
00296   }

00298   ######################################################################
00299   # Executes a safe winfo command.
00300   proc winfo_command {pname subcmd args} {
00301   
00302     variable interps
00303     
00304     switch $subcmd {
00305       atom -
00306       atomname -
00307       cells -
00308       children -
00309       class -
00310       colormapfull -
00311       depth -
00312       exists -
00313       fpixels -
00314       geometry -
00315       height -
00316       id -
00317       ismapped -
00318       manager -
00319       name -
00320       pixels -
00321       pointerx -
00322       pointerxy -
00323       pointery -
00324       reqheight -
00325       reqwidth -
00326       rgb -
00327       rootx -
00328       rooty -
00329       screen -
00330       screencells -
00331       screendepth -
00332       screenheight -
00333       screenmmheight -
00334       screenmmwidth -
00335       screenvisual -
00336       screenwidth -
00337       viewable -
00338       visual -
00339       visualsavailable -
00340       vrootheight -
00341       vrootwidth -
00342       vrootx -
00343       vrooty -
00344       width -
00345       x -
00346       y {
00347         if {[lsearch -index 0 $interps($pname,wins) [lindex $args 0]] == -1} {
00348           return -code error 
00349         }
00350         return [winfo $subcmd {*}$args]
00351       }
00352       containing -
00353       parent -
00354       pathname -
00355       toplevel {
00356         set win [winfo $subcmd {*}$args]
00357         if {[lsearch -index 0 $interps($pname,wins) $win] == -1} {
00358           return -code error "permission error"
00359         }
00360         return $win
00361       }
00362       default {
00363         return -code error "permission error"
00364       }
00365     }
00366   
00367   }

00370   # Executes a safe wm command.
00371   proc wm_command {pname subcmd win args} {
00372   
00373     variable interps
00374     
00375     if {[lsearch $interps($pname,wins) [list $win 1]] != -1} {
00376       return [wm $subcmd $win {*}$args]
00377     } else {
00378       return ""
00379     }

00383   ######################################################################
00384   # Executes a safe image command.
00385   proc image_command {pname subcmd args} {
00386   
00387     variable interps
00388     
00389     switch $subcmd {
00390       
00391       create {      
00392         
00393         # Find any -file or -maskfile options and convert the filename and check it
00394         set i 0
00395         while {$i < [llength $args]} {
00396           switch [lindex $args $i] {
00397             -file -
00398             -maskfile {
00399               if {[set fname [check_file $pname [lindex $args [incr i]]]] eq ""} {
00400                 return -error code "permission error"
00401               }
00402               lset args $i $fname
00403             }  
00404           }
00405           incr i
00406         }
00407       
00408         # Create the image
00409         set img [image create {*}$args]
00410         
00411         # Create an alias for the image so that it can be used in cget/configure calls
00412         $interps($pname,interp) alias $img interpreter::image_win $pname $img
00413       
00414         # Hang onto the generated image
00415         lappend interps($pname,images) $img
00416       
00417         return $img
00418         
00419       }
00420       
00421       delete {
00422         
00423         foreach name $args {
00424           if {[set img_index [lsearch $interps($pname,images) $name]] != -1} {
00425             set interps($pname,images) [lreplace $interps($pname,images) $img_index $img_index]
00426             image delete $name
00427           }
00428         }
00429         
00430       }
00431       
00432       default {
00433         
00434         return [image $subcmd {*}$args]
00435         
00436       } 
00437 
00438     }
00439   
00440   }
00441   
00442   ######################################################################
00443   # Handles a call to manipulate the image.
00444   proc image_win {pname img cmd args} {
00445   
00446     variable interps
00447     
00448     # Probably unnecessary, but it can't hurt to check that the image is part of this plugin
00449     if {[lsearch $interps($pname,images) $img] == -1} {
00450       return -code error "permission error"
00451     }
00452     
00453     switch $cmd {
00454       
00455       cget {
00456         
00457         switch [lindex $args 0] {
00458           -file -
00459           -maskfile {
00460             set fname [$img cget [lindex $args 0]]
00461             return [encode_file $pname $fname]
00462           }
00463         }
00464         
00465       }
00466       
00467       configure {
00468         
00469         set i 0
00470         while {$i < [llength $args]} {
00471           switch [lindex $args $i] {
00472             -file -
00473             -maskfile {
00474               if {[set fname [check_file $pname [lindex $args [incr i]]]] eq ""} {
00475                 return -code error "permission error"
00476               }
00477               lset args $i $fname
00478             }
00479           }
00480           incr i
00481         }
00482         
00483         return [$img configure {*}$args]
00484         
00485       }
00486       
00487     }
00488     
00489   }
00490   
00491   ######################################################################
00492   # Executes the open command.
00493   proc open_command {pname fname args} {
00494   
00495     variable interps
00496     
00497     # Make sure that the given filename is valid
00498     if {[set fname [check_file $pname $fname]] eq ""} {
00499       return -code error "permission error"
00500     }
00501     
00502     # Open the file
00503     if {[catch { open $fname {*}$args } rc]} {
00504       return -code error $rc
00505     }
00506     
00507     # Share the file stream with the interpreter
00508     interp share {} $rc $interps($pname,interp)
00509     
00510     # Save the file descriptor
00511     lappend interps($pname,files) $rc
00512     
00513     return $rc
00514   
00515   }
00516   
00517   ######################################################################
00518   # Executes the close command.
00519   proc close_command {pname channel} {
00520   
00521     variable interps
00522     
00523     if {[set index [lsearch $interps($pname,files) $channel]] != -1} {
00524       close $channel
00525       set interps($pname,files) [lreplace $interps($pname,files) $index $index]
00526     }
00527     
00528   }
00529 
00530   ######################################################################
00531   # Executes the flush command.
00532   proc flush_command {pname channel} {
00533   
00534     variable interps
00535     
00536     if {[lsearch $interps($pname,files) $channel] != -1} {
00537       flush $channel
00538     }
00539     
00540   }
00541   
00542   ######################################################################
00543   # Executes the exec command.
00544   proc exec_command {pname args} {
00545     
00546     variable interps
00547     
00548     if {![$interps($pname,interp) issafe]} {
00549       return [exec {*}$args]
00550     } else {
00551       return -code error "permission error"
00552     }
00553     
00554   }
00555   
00556   ######################################################################
00557   # Executes the file command.
00558   proc file_command {pname subcmd args} {
00559     
00560     variable interps
00561     
00562     switch $subcmd {
00563       
00564       atime -
00565       attributes -
00566       exists -
00567       executable -
00568       isdirectory -
00569       isfile -
00570       mtime -
00571       owned -
00572       readable -
00573       size -
00574       type -
00575       writable {
00576         if {[set fname [check_file $pname [lindex $args 0]]] eq ""} {
00577           return -code error "permission error"
00578         }
00579         return [file $subcmd $fname {*}[lrange $args 1 end]]
00580       }
00581       
00582       delete -
00583       copy -
00584       rename {
00585         set opts             [list]
00586         set fnames           [list]
00587         set double_dash_seen 0
00588         foreach arg $args {
00589           if {!$double_dash_seen && [string index $arg 0] eq "-"} {
00590             if {$arg eq "--"} {
00591               set double_dash_seen 1
00592             }
00593             lappend opts $arg
00594           } elseif {[set fname [check_file $pname $arg]] ne ""} {
00595             lappend fnames $fname
00596           } else {
00597             return -code error "permission error"
00598           }
00599         }
00600         return [file $subcmd {*}$opts {*}$fnames]
00601       }
00602       
00603       dirname {
00604         if {[set fname [check_file $pname [lindex $args 0]]] eq ""} {
00605           return -code error "permission error"
00606         }
00607         if {[set fname [check_file_access $pname [file dirname $fname]]] eq ""} {
00608           return -code error "permission error"
00609         }
00610         return [encode_file $pname $fname]
00611       }
00612       
00613       mkdir {
00614         set dnames [list]
00615         foreach arg $args {
00616           if {[set dname [check_file $pname $arg]] ne ""} {
00617             lappend dnames $dname
00618           }
00619         }
00620         if {[llength $dnames] > 0} {
00621           return [file mkdir {*}$dnames]
00622         } else {
00623           return -code error "permission error"
00624         }
00625       }
00626       
00627       join -
00628       extension -
00629       rootname -
00630       tail -
00631       separator -
00632       split {
00633         return [file $subcmd {*}$args]
00634       }
00635       
00636       default {
00637         if {![$interps($pname,interp) issafe]} {
00638           return [file $subcmd {*}$args]
00639         }
00640         return -code error "file command $subcmd is not allowed by a plugin"
00641       }
00642     }
00643     
00644   }
00645   
00646   ######################################################################
00647   # Executes the glob command.
00648   proc glob_command {pname args} {
00649     
00650     variable interps
00651     
00652     set i        0
00653     set new_args [list]
00654     
00655     # Parse the options
00656     while {$i < [llength $args]} {
00657       switch -exact [set opt [lindex $args $i]] {
00658         -directory -
00659         -path {
00660           if {[set dname [check_file $pname [lindex $args [incr i]]]] eq ""} {
00661             return -code error "permission error"
00662           }
00663           lappend new_args $opt $dname
00664         }
00665         default {
00666           lappend new_args $opt
00667         }
00668       } 
00669       incr i
00670     }
00671     
00672     # Encode the returned filenames
00673     set fnames [list]
00674     foreach fname [glob {*}$new_args] {
00675       if {[set ename [encode_file $pname $fname]] eq ""} {
00676         lappend fnames $fname
00677       } else {
00678         lappend fnames $ename
00679       }
00680     }
00681     
00682     return $fnames
00683     
00684   }
00685   
00686   ######################################################################
00687   # Creates and sets up a safe interpreter for a plugin.
00688   proc create {pname trust_granted} {
00689 
00690     variable interps
00691     
00692     # Setup the access paths
00693     lappend access_path $::tcl_library
00694     lappend access_path [file join $::tke_home plugins $pname]
00695     lappend access_path [file join $::tke_dir  plugins $pname]
00696     lappend access_path [file join $::tke_dir  plugins images]
00697     
00698     # Create the interpreter
00699     if {$trust_granted} {
00700       set interp [interp create]
00701     } else {
00702       set interp [::safe::interpCreate -nested true -accessPath $access_path]
00703     }
00704     
00705     # Save the interpreter and initialize the structure
00706     set interps($pname,interp) $interp
00707     set interps($pname,wins)   [list]
00708     set interps($pname,files)  [list]
00709     set interps($pname,images) [list]
00710     
00711     # If we are in development mode, share standard output for debug purposes
00712     if {[::tke_development]} {
00713       interp share {} stdout $interp
00714     }
00715     
00716     # Create Tcl command aliases if we are running in untrusted mode
00717     if {!$trust_granted} {
00718       foreach cmd [list close exec file flush glob open] {
00719         $interp alias $cmd interpreter::${cmd}_command $pname
00720       }
00721       $interp hide exit my_exit
00722     }
00723     
00724     # Create raw ttk widget aliases
00725     foreach widget [list canvas listbox menu text toplevel ttk::button ttk::checkbutton ttk::combobox \
00726                          ttk::entry ttk::frame ttk::label ttk::labelframe ttk::menubutton ttk::notebook \
00727                          ttk::panedwindow ttk::progressbar ttk::radiobutton ttk::scale ttk::scrollbar \
00728                          ttk::separator ttk::spinbox ttk::treeview ctext tokenentry] {
00729       $interp alias $widget interpreter::widget_command $pname $widget
00730     }
00731 
00732     # Create Tk commands
00733     foreach cmd [list clipboard event focus font grid pack place tk_messageBox] {
00734       $interp alias $cmd $cmd
00735     }
00736 
00737     # Specialized Tk commands
00738     foreach cmd [list destroy bind winfo wm image] {
00739       $interp alias $cmd interpreter::${cmd}_command $pname
00740     }
00741 
00742     # Recursively add all commands that are within the api namespace
00743     foreach pattern [list ::api::* {*}[join [namespace children ::api]::* {::* }]] {
00744       foreach cmd [info commands $pattern] {
00745         if {$cmd ne "::api::ns"} {
00746           $interp alias $cmd $cmd $interp $pname
00747         }
00748       }
00749     }
00750     
00751     # Create TKE command aliases
00752     $interp alias api::register          plugins::register
00753     $interp alias api::auto_adjust_color utils::auto_adjust_color  ;# TEMPORARY
00754     
00755     return $interp
00756     
00757   }
00758   
00759   ######################################################################
00760   # Destroys the interpreter at the given index.
00761   proc destroy {pname} {
00762   
00763     variable interps
00764     
00765     # Destroy any existing windows
00766     foreach win $interps($pname,wins) {
00767       if {[lindex $win 1]} {
00768         catch { ::destroy [lindex $win 0] }
00769       }
00770     }
00771     
00772     # Close any opened files
00773     foreach channel $interps($pname,files) {
00774       catch { close $channel }
00775     }
00776     
00777     # Destroy any images
00778     foreach img $interps($pname,images) {
00779       catch { image delete $img }
00780     }
00781 
00782     # Finally, destroy the interpreter
00783     catch { ::safe::interpDelete $interps($pname,interp) }
00784     
00785     # Destroy the interpreter for the given plugin name
00786     array unset interps $pname,*
00787     
00788   }
00789   
00790 }
